mdRecord.dcterms:title: The country twenty-five miles round New York / drawn by a gentleman from that city. ; Published according to Act of Parliament, 1st January, 1777, by W. Hawkes, (Successor to T. Kitchin) No. 59, Holborn Hill ; Price one shilling
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Gentleman from that City.
Hawkes, W.
Howe, William Howe Viscount, 1729-1814
Robert Sayer and John Bennett (Firm)
Seymour I. Schwartz Collection of North American Maps (University of Virginia)
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Printed for R. Sayer & J. Bennett, Map & Printsellers, No. 53 Fleet Street , as the act directs
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 38 x 39 cm., on sheet 63 x 50 cm. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: "J. Barbour, sculpt. Holburn Hill" has been removed from lower right corner of map, and the engraved description immediately below the map has been extended, bringing the date down to "[Nov.] 16th, Ft. Washington taken by Storm."
Shows radial distances ("The Spherical Lines are described Five Miles from each other."

Includes text: Chronological table of the most interesting occurrences since the commencement of hostilities in North America -- Alphabetical table of the principal Towns in North America, with their Distances from New-York -- Estimate of the People in the following Confederate Colonies; taken by Order of the Congress, September, 1774 -- Staten-Island, 1st August, 1776. British Order of Battle, as settled by a Council of War. His Excellency Sir William Howe, Commander in Chief... -- Troops under General Sir William Howe in America -- Naval Force under Admiral Lord Howe in America -- State of the Provincial Forces in May 1775.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: "No. 65" and title handwritten on verso. Gift of Seymour I. Schwartz, December, 2006.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: New York Region--Maps--Early works to 1800.
